intro: Desmoschoenus, commonly known as the saltbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs adapted to saline and arid environments. They possess small, succulent leaves that help reduce water loss and tolerate high salt concentrations. Desmoschoenus species are often found in coastal areas, salt lakes, and inland saline soils. Their ability to thrive in harsh conditions makes them valuable for ecological restoration and soil stabilization.
